description: Ms. codex. Title provided by cataloger. 13 lines per page. Written by one hand in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible. Collation notes (see collation statement fol. 65a, fol. 69a). Fol. 1 mended. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Label with the inscription in Arabic "1928 numrah 12" pasted on the upper cover. Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Naqīb al-Ḥanafī from a copy written by the author in Dhū al-Ḥijjah 774 (colophons, fol. 43a, 52a, 65a and 69a). Collation: Paper; fol. 70: 1¹⁰ (+ 1, fol. 11) 2-5¹⁰ 6⁸ (+1, fol. 62); catchword on the verso of each leaf; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "al-rābiʻ min al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr" (see fol. 32a; the numbering is lost on most quires due to the trimming of the pages).
author: Ibn Hishām, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf, 1309-1360
abstract: Collection of treatises on grammar by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf Ibn Hishām al-Naḥwī.
extent: 70 leaves : paper ; 172 x 125 (100 x 80) mm. bound to 172 x 135 mm.
title: Kitāb al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr fī al-naḥw ... [etc.].
provenance: Ownership statements on fol. 70b (hardly legible). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: ابن هشام، عبد الله بن يوسف
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Light cream paper pasted on brown leather for upper and lower covers and envelope flap. Light cream paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
